page.title: 04CHURCHES
page.content: {ST.MARYS MAGDALENE CHURCH}in Loders was built in about 1100AD. It has a Norman window, also it has a old Saxon doorway and an old 14th century chest which has never been opened in living memory.{The Rev. Alex Martin}is the vicar of several churches such as Askerswell, Powerstock, North Poorton and Dottery. There is a Priest Room above the porch, which is mainly used for storage. On Christmas Eve they have a midnight service. The church belongs to the Diocese of Salisbury. There are 28 pews which often holds communion of about 21 but the size has increased to about 30 because of a mid-day service. The grave yard dates back to about 1600 to 1700AD. Inside the church there is a very old memorial dating back to 1011AD. St Mary's Church is twinned with another church in France.
